bioghist.p: William Boyer is Charles Polk Messick Professor Emeritus of Public Administration and former Chair of the Department of Political Science at the University of Delaware. He is the author of Governing Delaware and has written extensively about public policy issues in Delaware, the United States, and abroad. A graduate of the College of Wooster, Boyer received his master's and doctoral degrees from the University of Wisconsin in Madison, after which he served as an assistant to the governor of Wisconsin and in other government positions. At the University of Delaware, he was co-founder of the master of public administration degree program and helped establish study abroad programs in Geneva and Costa Rica.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of William Boyer. The bulk of the collection consists of files Boyer compiled in the process of writing a book on the state of Delaware. The files cover Delaware's politics and government, health, education, housing, economics, environment, crime, and demographics. Materials include printed technical and research reports and statistical summaries; newspaper and magazine articles; and academic theses. The collection also includes audio tapes from the 1960s of Boyer speaking on international and domestic political issues.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
